item.title: The Macroeconomics of Free Digital Services
item.description: In this article, we develop a growth model with digital service providers collecting data from households in exchange for using their services to sell targeted advertising to traditional companies. item.title: Asssessing the Role of Immigration Policy for Foreign Students: the Case of Campus France
item.description: Using a Diff-in-Diff-in-Diff approach, we test the impact of Campus France on the volume of enrollments in French universities. We pay attention to the heterogeneity of these effects across different types of universities.

item.title: Discrete Time Dynamics
Should the US have locked heaven’s door?
item.description: This paper examines the economic impact of the second great immigration wave (1945–2000) on the US economy. Contrary to recent studies, we show that immigration induced important net gains and small redistributive effects among natives.

item.title: Quel avenir pour le Fonds de réserve pour les retraites ?
item.description: We use a model based on the latest forecasts by the French Retirement Advisory Council (Conseil d?Orientation des Retraites : COR) at the moment when the study was carried out and a Bootstrap simulation of the rate of return on the financial portfolio of the French Pension Reserve Fund (Fonds de Réserve pour les Retraites : FRR). Our results indicate that the FRR will cover at most 24 % of the expected deficit in 2020 and 14.9 % in 2040.

item.title: Quel mode de scrutin pour quel « vainqueur » ? Une expérience sur le vote préférentiel transférable
item.description: In this paper, we expose the results of a voting experiment realised in 2007, during the French Presidential election. This experiment aimed at confronting the Single Transferable Vote (SVT) procedure to two criteria : simplicity and the selection of a Condorcet-winner.

item.title: The optimal carbon sequestration in agricultural soils: Do the dynamics of the physical process matter?
item.description: This paper takes explicitly into account the temporality of sequestration. Its first contribution lies in the modelling of the asymmetry of the sequestration/de-sequestration process at a micro level, and of its consequences at a macro level.
